FuncDef: The reset acl counter command clears statistics about a specified or all ACLs. The reset acl counter command clears statistics about a specified or all ACLs.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the number of an ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999, the number of a basic ACL ranges from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies the number of an ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 5000 to 5999, the number of a user ACL ranges from 5000 to 5999.

Specifies the number of an ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 3000 to 3999, the number of an advanced ACL ranges from 3000 to 3999.

Specifies the number of an ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 23000 to 23999, the number of an ARP-based ACL ranges from 23000 to 23999.

Specifies the number of an ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 4000 to 4999, the number of a Layer 2 ACL ranges from 4000 to 4999.

ExtraInfo: To clear statistics about a specified or all ACLs, run the reset acl counter command. Before collecting ACL statistics in a specified period, run this command to clear the original statistics.
